Note on figures
Most of these figures are World Bank figures from 2013 or 2014. Please note that monetary figures are for the most part converted into USD prices based on currency conversions at prevailing market exchange rates.
Note that purchasing power parity (PPP) estimates of GDP are sometimes preferred to exchange-rate GDP estimates. This is because PPP estimates of GDP account for variations in the cost of goods and services across country. For example, a given unit of value will often buy you more Big Macs in a poor country than a rich country.
